body.para: On Sun, Jan 06, 2002 at 09:29:42PM -0600, Len Conrad wrote:

quote.quotepara: ifconfig_fxp0="inet 10.1.1.1 netmask 255.255.255.0 media autoselect" ifconfig_fxp1="inet 10.1.2.1 netmask 255.255.255.0 media autoselect" ifconfig_fxp2="inet 192.168.253.59 netmask 255.255.255.0 media autoselect" ifconfig_fxp3="inet 10.1.4.1 netmask 255.255.255.0 media autoselect" ifconfig_fxp4="inet 10.1.5.1 netmask 255.255.255.0 media autoselect"
we can ping from a PC on net 10.1.5.0/24 to a PC on net 10.1.1.0/24, so box as gateway and routing are working.
then send broadcasts from the PC on 10.1.5.0/24 to these ports:
trafshow indicates that broadcasts originate on 10.1.5.0/24, but nothing appears on the other nets.

body.para: Uh, nowhere? That is the required behavior. 255.255.255.255 is the _local_ broadcast address. It never crosses a router.
